title: Why did you gut junglers?
body:
Please, I don't get it.
You said you wanted to increase variety.
But instead of tweaking the two overperforming champions you nerfed the jungle items. Several times.
When ranged champions started to see play in the jungle you nerfed it. Instantly. Making it impossible.

You increased the cooldown of Smite. A Trailblazer nerf without any compensation and then a 2nd nerf followed. Okay, the 45s CD made it too strong in terms of objective control, but you didn't consider champs which relied on its sustain (CD went from 45 to 75s, health/mana gain unchanged).

You nerfed the other Smites, too. And why?
Because Warwick was able to break the maximum amounts of attacks per second with his ultimate at level 6 (thus exceeding even full-ASP-on-hit-build procs).
Again instead of tweaking the champion properly you nerfed the item.

And just now you nerfed the cost of all T2 jungle items, heavily hurting champions which rely on them for their early clear.

Seriously, each step taken in the last 2 month feels like a big contradiction:

- Jungler shouldn't gank early. Thus we purposely destroy their early levels.
- Oh look. Junglers are farming their jungle. We don't want them to farm their jungle. We increase the smite CD.

I think people need to stop complaining about variety. Personally I'm happy the jungle is tough and not everyone can go Ashe jungle or lulu jungle and be successful. Champs that were designed to jungle will make it through the jungle just fine if you know what your doing.

The worst thing that ever happen in this game was last season when every champ and their mother could make it through the jungle healthy.. the most BS thing ever.

To be extremely honest they need to make the jungle even tougher, tweak the actual junglers and jungle items a bit and completely eradicate any possibility of any squishy champ ever seeing time in the jungle.

"I think people need to stop complaining about variety."

Riot stated that they wanted to increase variety in the jungle. People are complaining because Riot's actions are doing the opposite of what they said they wanted. The complaints are justified.

> When ranged champions started to see play in the jungle you nerfed it. Instantly. Making it impossible.

Just to jump in, that was more of what the ranged champions were doing to the jungle than the champions themselves. I mean, it was hardly fair that they literally got to go through the jungle while taking little-to-no damage at all. If they're going to jungle, might as well put them on the same playing field.

One missstep and reset - and you'ld fall behind 15s and loose a quarter of your health for nothing.
Separating the bad junglers from the great junglers.

Twisted Fate and Lulu were played at tournaments.
But instead of dominating them they got dominated quite often.
Simply because even a full health Lulu is extremely squishy when played in the jungle and can be 1-hit-combo'd by a Lee Sin or Xin .

We saw variety nad it was destroyed. Not because it was broken, but because Riot didn't like that kind of variety for some unknown reason.

I feel like riot knee-jerk reacts too much when it comes to balance. The players are smarter than they are given credit for, but with riot constantly reacting to what is "op" over the years, it really feels like the community is now overly dependent on riot to fix problems for us instead of us looking for alternatives to counter what is FotM.
http://cdn.funnyisms.com/023d4093-e32c-4824-8cb2-08179572dddb.gif Riot when it thinks something is op

Instead, they chose an option where ranged had to be forced on the same level as melee, which 'destroyed it'.
you do realize that it would be impossible for them to clear otherwise, right? most ranged champs are too squishy to tank the jungle like the melee champs.

I don't agree. Mainly because at that point(pre-nerf), melee *and *ranged champions could exploit the soft resets and take less damage if they knew what they were doing. I'm not one of those people(my skills are laughable), but I had seen it done. Now(post-nerf) I don't see people even bothering with it. Poor junglers just smack their heads on the monsters until they're too bloody to continue, then mute chat so they don't have to listen to the lanes whining about not being able to hold lane for 4 minutes.

It really has to do with Riot playing favourites with the jungle. They came out and said that this latest nerf to the jungle hurt more than the 2 or three champions who were dominating. Until they change one champion they will not be able to balance the rest of the jungle. Every attempt to balance the jungle in the last two years has failed because of this. They will continue to fail because of this and their refusal to deal with the issue at hand. It's become such a large deal that the replies to this issue are confused and split by each Rioter that braves the boards. 

Rioter #1 "blank champion is balanced"
Rioter #2 "we know blank champion is having a negative impact on the jungle"
I'm surprised that people haven't reverted to having no jungler and having a duo lane at top. Or better yet, simply having the "jungler" grab buffs and then duo lane with top.
I've done that. Works impressively well.

here's the REAL question
why'd they gut TANKS?

I've said it the past 2 years that the balance team didn't have a god damn clue what they're doing.  At its current state, jungling is near impossible if you're looking to make a difference in lanes.  Even when you do power farm in the jungle, the XP is still far behind lanes, meaning you're still level 4 or 5 while laners are hitting 6 or 7.  If you DO gank lane, if you fail, you're even further behind.  I've had to revert to my season 3 strat of taxing lanes for XP when one of my laners goes back to base just to stay EVEN.  On top of the stupidity of most junglers having their health depleted after the first 3 camps (thereby forcing them to return to base), they increased the cost of the jungle items, so now you can't even afford health pots on your return to the jungle.

The season 4 jungle may have had its problems, but at least I felt I was making a difference and could carry games easier if my laners fell behind, and I could play more than 3 viable junglers.  Now, I have to hope my laners at least go even with their counterparts, because I'm more reliant on THEM to get to where I need to be.  It's just another case of Riot placating to making their LCS more watchable, but making their game less playable.

Thanks Riot for making the one role I enjoyed playing and completely f*cking trashing it.  The people working on your balance team are just throwing poo at a wall and hoping it sticks.

Trailblazer was the original reasoning why they gave the jungle items such horrible mana regeneration.
